definition: to come together to form a single thing or group; to join two or more things or groups together to form a single one
to have two or more different features or characteristics; to put two or more different things, features or qualities together
to do two or more things at the same time
to come together in order to work or act together; to put two things or groups together so that they work or act together
to work together in order to achieve a shared aim
a deep track that a wheel makes in soft ground
a boring way of life that does not change
the time of year when male animals, especially deer, become sexually active
the distance that light travels in one year, 9.4607 × 1012 kilometres
connected with the way in which the different parts of something are arranged; connected with an organization
having or showing the ability to arrange or organize things well
respected and admired as very important or of very high quality
connected with mountains, especially with their position and shape
